translation: Sutra on the Collection of the Past Activities of the Buddha, Volume 59

source_sentence: 隋天竺三藏闍那崛多譯
translation: Sui Tianzhu Tripiṭaka Jñānagupta Translation

source_sentence: 婆提唎迦等因緣品下
translation: (Skt. Bhadrika et al., Second Chapter of Causal Links)

source_sentence: 爾時，長老提婆達多見其阿難往向佛所，而告之言：「長老阿難！
translation: It was then that the elder Devadatta saw Ānanda going to the Buddha and told him, "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 欲何處去？」
translation: Where do you want to go?"

source_sentence: 爾時，阿難而報之曰：「我於今者，欲往見佛。」
translation: Ānanda then answered, "Now, I want to go see the Buddha."

source_sentence: 爾時，長老提婆達多報阿難言：「阿難！
translation: It was then that the elder Devadatta reported to Ānanda, "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 汝今若必然者，少時相待，我亦欲往諮優波陀，共汝相隨俱往佛處。」
translation: Now, if you must, wait a little while while while I also wish to consult Upādhāra and accompany you to the Buddha."

source_sentence: 爾時，提婆達多即至跋[口*耶]瑟吒僧伽之所，頂禮其足，却住一面，而白之言：「我今意欲往見於佛，唯願尊者慈愍聽許。」
translation: Devadatta then went to the Saṃgha of [Kṣudraka] Vātsīputrīya, bowed his head at his feet, withdrew to one side, and said, "Now, I would like to go to see the Buddha, but I beg you, Venerable, to have the kindness to grant it."

source_sentence: 爾時，長老跋[口*耶]瑟吒僧伽報彼提婆達多，作如是言：「汝若知時，往至佛所，為我通傳，頂禮佛足，問訊世尊，少病少惱，身安以不？
translation: It was then that the elder Bhātriṃśāsaka replied to Devadatta, saying, "If you know the time, will you go to the Buddha, transmit it for me, bow at his feet, and ask him about the Bhagavān, whether he's less ill and less troubled, and whether he's at peace with himself?

source_sentence: 起居輕利，行來化導，不損德也？
translation: Is it not harmful to virtue to live modestly and conduct oneself in a way that guides?

source_sentence: 身體氣力，勝常以不？」
translation: Is there any way to surpass ordinary people in terms of physical strength?"

source_sentence: 提婆達多報彼跋[口*耶]瑟吒僧伽，作如是言：「如尊者教，不敢違背。」
translation: Devadatta reported to that monk Bhātriṃśasena and said, "As the venerable has taught, I dare not disobey him."

source_sentence: 遂即頂禮，圍遶三匝，辭退而去。
translation: He then paid homage, circled the monk three times, withdrew, and departed.

source_sentence: 爾時，阿難與彼長老提婆達多，二人相隨，發雪山下，往向佛所，到佛所已，頭面禮足，却住一面。
translation: Then, Ānanda and the elder Devadatta followed them down the snow-capped mountain to the Buddha's place, and when they arrived, they bowed their heads and feet and withdrew to one side.

source_sentence: 爾時，長老提婆達多白佛言：「世尊！
translation: It was then that the elder Devadatta said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我昔求請如來出家，如來而不與我出家，如來今日可不見我得出家耳。」
translation: I once asked the Tathāgata to leave home, but the Tathāgata didn't grant me permission to leave home, so the Tathāgata may not see me leave home today."

source_sentence: 爾時，佛告提婆達多，作如是言：「提婆達多！
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed Devadatta and said, "Devadatta!

source_sentence: 汝為何事而出家也？
translation: For what reason did you leave home?

source_sentence: 願汝得已，莫有背也。」
translation: May you not turn your back on it once you've attained it."

source_sentence: 時，諸比丘俱白佛言：「希有世尊！
translation: The monks then all said to the Buddha, "It's rare, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 世尊往昔，恒常教彼提婆達多為利益事，提婆達多今反投佛以為怨讎？」
translation: In the past, the Bhagavān always taught that Devadatta to do good works, but now Devadatta has turned to the Buddha as a grudge?"

source_sentence: 作是語已，佛告諸比丘，作如是言：「汝諸比丘！
translation: After he said this, the Buddha addressed the monks and said in this way, "You monks!

source_sentence: 非但今日我教彼人提婆達多為利益事，反為其人以我為怨。
translation: Not only did I teach that person Devadatta to do something for their benefit today, but they also held me as a grudge against me.

source_sentence: 過去世時，亦復如是，我教利益，反怨於我。」
translation: In a past life, it was likewise when I taught them to benefit and they turned out to resent me."

source_sentence: 時，諸比丘白佛言：「世尊！
translation: The monks then said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 此事云何？
translation: What is this matter?

source_sentence: 願為論說。」
translation: Please explain it for us."

source_sentence: 爾時，佛告諸比丘言：「我念往昔，久遠世時，於雪山下，有二頭鳥，同共一身，在於彼住。
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed the monks, "I remember a time long ago, long ago, when there were two birds with one head that lived together under a snowy mountain.

source_sentence: 一頭名曰迦嘍嗏鳥，一名優波迦嘍嗏鳥。
translation: One was named the kāsana bird, and the other was the upākāsana bird.

source_sentence: 而彼二鳥，一頭若睡，一頭便覺。
translation: Those two birds, one head was asleep, and the other head was awake.

source_sentence: 其迦嘍嗏，又時睡眠，近彼覺頭，有一果樹，名摩頭迦，其樹華落風吹，至彼所覺頭邊。
translation: When that kāṣāya limited is asleep and near to its awakened head, there's a fruit tree named madhuka whose flowers fall and the wind blows, reaching the side of its awakened head.

source_sentence: 其頭爾時，作如是念：『我今雖復獨食此華，若入於腹，二頭俱時得色得力，並除飢渴。』
translation: That head then had this thought, 'Even though I'm eating this flower alone, if I were to put it in my belly, both heads would attain form and strength and be freed from hunger and thirst.'

source_sentence: 而彼覺頭，遂即不令彼睡頭覺，亦不告知，默食彼華。
translation: The awakened head then didn't make the sleeping head awaken, and he didn't tell them to eat the flower in silence.

source_sentence: 其彼睡頭，於後覺時，腹中飽滿，咳噦氣出，即語彼頭作如是言：『汝於何處得此香美微妙飲食而噉食之？
translation: When he later awakens, his belly is full, and he coughs out gas, so he says to the sleepy head, 'Where did you obtain this delicious, subtle food and drink and devour it?'

source_sentence: 令我身體，安隱飽滿，令我所出音聲微妙。』
translation: It fills my body with well-being and makes the sounds that come out of me sound exquisite.'

source_sentence: 彼頭報言：『汝睡眠時，此處去我頭邊不遠，有摩頭迦華果之樹，當於彼時，一華墮落，在我頭邊。
translation: The monk replied, 'While you were sleeping, there was a madhugga flower-fruit tree not far from my head, and at that time, a flower fell down and landed near my head.

source_sentence: 我於爾時，作如是念：「今我但當獨食此華，若入於腹，俱得色力，並除飢渴。」
translation: At the time, I thought, 'Now, I'll eat this flower alone; if I put it in my belly, it will give me form and power and relieve my hunger and thirst.'

source_sentence: 是故我時不令汝覺，亦不語知，即食此華。』
translation: I therefore didn't want you to realize it, nor did I say anything to you about it, so I ate this flower.'

source_sentence: 爾時彼頭聞此語已，即生瞋恚嫌恨之心，作如是念：『其所得食，不語我知、不喚我覺，即便自食。
translation: After hearing this, that man then became angry and resentful and thought, 'He won't tell me to know what food he's getting, and he won't call me to it, so he'll eat it himself.

source_sentence: 若如此者，我從今後，所得飲食，我亦不喚彼覺語知。』
translation: If that's the case, from now on I won't call their attention or speak to them about the food I've obtained.'

source_sentence: 而彼二頭，至於一時，遊行經歷，忽然值遇一箇毒華，便作是念：『我食此華，願令二頭，俱時取死。』
translation: When those two heads were traveling through the experience, they suddenly came upon a poisonous flower and thought, 'When I eat this flower, I hope it will cause the two heads to both die.'

source_sentence: 于時語彼迦嘍嗏言：『汝今睡眠，我當覺住。』
translation: He then said to that man Kāśyapa, 'Now that you're asleep, I will awaken and abide.'

source_sentence: 時迦嘍嗏聞彼優波迦嘍嗏頭如是語已，便即睡眠。
translation: After hearing that man Upakauṣṭha Limited said that, he then went to sleep.

source_sentence: 其彼優波迦嘍嗏頭，尋食毒華。
translation: That Upakauṣṭha limited sought to eat poisonous flowers.

source_sentence: 迦嘍嗏頭既睡覺已，咳噦氣出，於是即覺有此毒氣，而告彼頭作如是言：『汝向覺時，食何惡食？
translation: After he fell asleep, he coughed up gaseous effluvia, and then he realized the presence of this poisonous gas and told that man, 'What bad food did you eat while you were awake?'

source_sentence: 令我身體，不得安隱，命將欲死。
translation: It's caused my body to be unstable, and my life is about to die.

source_sentence: 又令我今語言麤澁，欲作音聲，障礙不利。』
translation: It also makes my speech now coarse and my desire to make sounds an obstruction.'

source_sentence: 於是覺頭報彼頭言：『汝睡眠時，我食毒華，願令二頭，俱時取死。』
translation: The awakened head then reported to the other head, saying, 'While you were asleep, I ate poisoned flowers, hoping to cause both heads to attain death at the same time.'

source_sentence: 於時彼頭，語別頭言：『汝所為者，一何太卒，云何乃作如是事也？』
translation: The other head then said to the other head, 'What did you do, one too many deaths, and why did you do such a thing?'

source_sentence: 即說偈言：「『汝於昔日睡眠時，　　我食妙華甘美味，　　其華風吹在我邊，　　汝反生此大瞋恚？
translation: He then spoke the verse, saying, "In the past, when you were asleep, I ate a wonderful flower that was sweet and delicious, and the wind blew it near me, but you became very angry with me?

source_sentence: 凡是癡人願莫見，　　亦願莫聞癡共居，　　與癡共居無利益，　　自損及以損他身。』」
translation: May no one see or hear of deluded people living together, and living with delusion is not beneficial; it damages oneself and damages others.'"

source_sentence: 佛告諸比丘：「汝等若有心疑，彼時迦嘍嗏鳥，食美華者？
translation: The Buddha addressed the monks, "Do you have any doubt in your minds about that bird Kālāśa eating a beautiful flower?

source_sentence: 莫作異見，即我身是。
translation: Don't get a different view, for that's who I am.

source_sentence: 彼時優波迦嘍嗏鳥，食毒華者，即此提婆達多是也。
translation: Upakāya Limited, the bird that ate the poisonous flowers, was this Devadatta.

source_sentence: 我於彼時，為作利益，反生瞋恚。
translation: At the time, I was trying to get something for its own benefit, but I became angry with it.

source_sentence: 今亦復爾，我教利益，反更用我為怨讐也。」
translation: Now, likewise, I taught them to benefit, but they used me as an enemy."

source_sentence: 爾時，長老婆提唎迦既出家已，即於彼時，夏三月內，成就三通；摩尼婁陀，得成天眼；長老跋涪婆，長老因耆，長老難提迦，此諸人等，證羅漢果；阿難復得須陀洹果；提婆達多成就世間凡夫神通。
translation: After she left home, the elder wife Tilika then attained the three supernormal powers during the summer and early summer months; Maṇilūta attained the divine eye; the elders Bhāvabhūpa, Nandika, and Nandika realized the fruit of the arhat; Ānanda again realized the fruit of stream entry; and Devadatta attained the worldly supernormal powers of ordinary people.

source_sentence: 爾時，長老婆提唎迦得羅漢果，或在樹林，或住在於空閑房室，或住露地，或住在於祇陀園林，晝夜三時，恒唱是言：「嗚呼快樂！
translation: At the time, the elder wife Dīrikā, who had attained the arhatship, was staying either in a forest, in an empty house, on bare ground, or in the Jetavana Grove, and at three times during the day and night, she was always saying, "Oooh, happy!

source_sentence: (如是三稱)。」
translation: (Thus are the three terms)."

source_sentence: 爾時，眾多諸比丘等，詣向佛所，而白佛言：「世尊！
translation: At the time, a large group of monks went to the Buddha and said to him, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 其彼長老婆提唎迦喬瞿彌子，不樂在於世尊法中，不喜不樂，恒常憶昔王位時事富貴之樂，恒常憶念如此事故，或住樹下，或住空房，或在露地，三時唱言：『嗚呼快樂(如是三稱)！』」
translation: That long-wife, Tilakachogomitra, doesn't enjoy being in the Bhagavān's Dharma, isn't delighted or happy, always recollects the wealth and happiness of the events of the past when he was king, and always recollects such events, whether living under a tree, in an empty house, or in the open ground, when he thrice chants, 'Oooh, joy!'

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊喚一比丘而告之言：「汝來比丘！
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān called a monk and told him, "You monks!

source_sentence: 當往詣彼婆提唎迦比丘之邊，而為我語，作如是言：『世尊喚汝。』」
translation: You must go to that monk Bhadrika and speak for me, saying, 'The Bhagavān summons you!'"

source_sentence: 其彼比丘白言：「如教，不敢違也。」
translation: The monk said, "As I was taught, I dare not disobey you."

source_sentence: 即往詣彼婆提唎迦長老之所到已告言：「婆提唎迦！
translation: He then went to that elder Bhadrika and when he arrived, he said, "Bhadrika!

source_sentence: 世尊喚汝。」
translation: The Bhagavān summons you."

source_sentence: 爾時，長老婆提唎迦聞彼語已，詣向佛所，到已頂禮，却住一面。
translation: After hearing those words, Jātaka Bodhirucija went to the Buddha, paid homage when he arrived, and withdrew to one side.

source_sentence: 爾時，佛告婆提唎迦，作如是言：「婆提唎迦！
translation: At that point, the Buddha addressed Bhadrika and said, "Bhadrika!

source_sentence: 汝實不樂於我法中行梵行不？
translation: Do you really dislike the practice of celibacy in the midst of my teaching?

source_sentence: 恒常憶昔王位樂不？
translation: Does he constantly remember the pleasure of his former position as king?

source_sentence: 由憶彼故，或在樹下，或在閑房，或在露處，三時唱言：『嗚呼快樂！
translation: When he is under a tree, in a dwelling, or in a dewy place, he says, 'Oh, joy!

source_sentence: 嗚呼快樂！』
translation: Happy Woo-Hoo!

source_sentence: 如是以不？」
translation: Is this the case?"

source_sentence: 爾時，長老婆提唎迦而白佛言：「如是世尊！
translation: It was then that Dīrikā, the elder wife, said to the Buddha, "So it is, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 如是跋檀多！」
translation: Thus Bhadanta!"

source_sentence: 佛復告言：「汝見何利？
translation: The Buddha again told them, "What benefit do you see?

source_sentence: 或在樹下，乃至三時唱如是言：『嗚呼快樂！
translation: Perhaps he sings this under a tree up to three times, saying, 'Oooh, happy!

source_sentence: 嗚呼快樂！』」
translation: Oooh Happy!"

source_sentence: 爾時，長老婆提唎迦白佛言：「世尊！
translation: It was then that Dīrikā, the elder wife, said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我昔在家，治於王位，剎利灌頂，七重牆壁，圍我宮殿，守護我等。
translation: In the past, when I was at home and ruled the king's throne, there were seven walls surrounding my palace and guarding us.

source_sentence: 復有象軍，七重守護，復有馬軍，如是七重，復有車軍，及以步軍，皆各七重，俱被鎧甲，手執戎仗，所謂弓箭刀槊矛楯，金剛大杵，及大鐵棒，矛鑹鐵輪，三叉鉞斧，諸戎仗等，周匝遶我，牆外復有七重水壍。
translation: There was also an elephant army, which was guarded seven times, a horse army, which was guarded seven times, a chariot army, and a foot army, each with seven layers of armor, carrying weapons, such as bows, arrows, swords, lances, spears, shields, a vajra pounder, a large iron rod, a spear, a metal wheel, a trident, and other weapons, all surrounding me, and seven layers of water outside the walls.

source_sentence: 如是守護，如是障蔽，猶於夜中，若聞諸聲，心生恐怖，不得安樂，身毛皆竪，恒生慚愧，諸根變動。
translation: Thus guarded and thus obstructed, it's like at night when I hear sounds, my mind becomes frightened and uncomfortable, my body hair stands on end, I'm constantly conscience-stricken, and my faculties are shaken.

source_sentence: 世尊我今，或在樹下，或在閑房，或在露處，夜聞種種諸惡獸聲，無有恐怖，身毛不竪，無有慚愧，諸根不變。
translation: Bhagavān, now, when I'm under a tree, in a dwelling, or in an open space at night, I hear the sounds of various ungodly animals, but I'm not frightened, my hair doesn't stand on end, I have no shame, and my faculties remain unchanged.

source_sentence: 是故我恒獨坐思惟，心作是念：『我今大得利益之事，今者世尊為我大師，自覺說法，於彼法中，我得出家，行於梵行，多有禁戒，攝受於我，成妙行人。
translation: Therefore, I'm always sitting alone, thinking, and I think, 'Now, I've greatly benefited from this, for the Bhagavān is my great teacher and has himself realized that he teaches the Dharma, and within that Dharma, I've left home, practiced the religious life, and have many prohibitions and precepts that have been adopted by me as a wonderful practitioner.

source_sentence: 我於今者，善得活命，善得命終。』
translation: Now, I've attained a good life and a good end to my life.'

source_sentence: 是故世尊！
translation: Therefore, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我以往昔王位樂時及富貴時，比於今日出家之樂，坐空閑樂、覺觀之樂、寂定之樂、沙門等樂，憶念此故，或在樹下，或在閑房，或在露處，知足少欲，從他乞食，身毛不竪，猶如山鹿，心得自在，坐臥去住，無有障礙。
translation: I take the happiness of my former position as king and the times when I was rich and powerful as compared to the happiness of today's renunciant monk, the happiness of sitting in an empty house, the happiness of perception, the happiness of calm concentration, and the happiness of a monk.

source_sentence: 三時唱言：『嗚呼快樂！』
translation: Three times, he calls out, 'Oooh, happy!'

source_sentence: 如是三稱。」
translation: These are the three terms."

source_sentence: 爾時，長老婆提唎迦在於佛前，對諸大眾，而說偈言：「我昔在於深宮裏，　　七重牆壁甚高峻，　嚴治樓櫓及却敵，　　并有七重隍塹等，　軍眾宿衛執戎仗，　　無晝無夜守護我，　如是種種自防守，　　身意猶故不安寧。
translation: At the time, Jāṅgulī Tilaka was present before the Buddha and addressed the crowd, saying, "Once, I was in a deep palace with seven high walls, a tightly packed tower and a defensive tower, seven moats and so forth, an army of guards holding military weapons, guarding me day and night, and defending myself in this way, but my body and mind were still unsettled.

source_sentence: 我今在於世尊前，　　無有一人守護我，　及以在於空閑處，　　或在樹下山林中，　如我佛子婆提迦，　　諸人各各相守護，　行住坐臥常安樂，　　是故心無有攀緣。
translation: Now, when I'm in the Bhagavān's presence, there's no one guarding me, nor am I in a lonely place or under a tree in a forest, like my son Bhadrika, who is guarded by each other, always at ease when walking, standing, sitting, and lying down; therefore, my mind has no attachments.

source_sentence: 我昔宮內乘大象，　　身著繒綵上妙衣，　食噉粳粮甘美飯，　　羹臛調和肉味等。
translation: In the past, I rode a large elephant inside the palace, wearing silken and fine clothing, eating a diet of refined grains and sweet rice, and preparing meats in a delicious way.

source_sentence: 今者坐臥隨意鋪，　　空閑身著糞掃衣，　捨愛拔除苦根本，　　欲有所行隨我意。」
translation: Now, I sit and lay down as I like, wearing a dusting robe in my spare body, abandoning craving and uprooting the root of suffering, and following my desires for whatever actions I want."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊因此事故，復說偈言：「若人知命不生惱，　　亦即不憂是命終，　若能勇猛見真諦，　　雖墮苦海終無怖。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān spoke again in verse, saying, "If a person knows their life and doesn't become distressed, that's when they don't worry about their life ending, and if they can courageously see the true truth, they'll never fear falling into the ocean of suffering.

source_sentence: 已斷有愛比丘等，　　於一切物悉已斷，　生死煩惱皆滅盡，　　如是無復有後有。」
translation: Monks and others who have ended craving for existence have ended all things, and the afflictions of birth-and-death have all ceased; thus, there's no more afterlife."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告諸比丘，作如是言：「汝諸比丘！
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the monks and said, "You monks!

source_sentence: 若知於我聲聞弟子豪貴之中，捨家出家最第一者，所謂即此婆提唎迦比丘是也。」
translation: If you knew that among the noble śrāvaka disciples, the one who renounces home and leaves home is the most distinguished, that's the monk Bhadrika."

source_sentence: 爾時，諸比丘白佛言：「世尊！
translation: It was then that the monks said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 今此長老婆提唎迦，往於昔日，造何善根？
translation: "Now, what good roots did this elder wife, Dīrikā, create in the past?

source_sentence: 今生釋種大豪貴家，乃至多饒資財產業，無所乏少。
translation: I've been born into a great noble family of the Śākyas, and I've accumulated a lot of wealth and property, so there's nothing lacking.

source_sentence: 復作何業？
translation: What other activity will he do?

source_sentence: 承繼釋種，得昇王位。
translation: Inheriting the lineage of Śākyamuni, he rose to the throne.

source_sentence: 復作何業？
translation: What further action will he take?

source_sentence: 便得出家，受具足戒，獲羅漢果。
translation: He then left home, received the full set of precepts, and attained the fruit of the arhat.

source_sentence: 世尊復記：『汝諸比丘！
translation: The Bhagavān then recorded, 'You monks!

source_sentence: 若於聲聞弟子之中，捨彼豪望而出家者，婆提唎迦最為第一。』」
translation: If there's one śrāvaka disciple who renounces their prestige and leaves home, Bhadrika is the most eminent.'"

source_sentence: 爾時，佛告諸比丘僧作如是言：「汝諸比丘！
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed the monks and said, "You monks!

source_sentence: 我念往昔久遠之時，有一貧人，以乞自活，從一城至波羅[木*奈]城。
translation: I think back in the distant past there was a poor man who begged for his own living and went from one city to the city of Pola [munai].

source_sentence: 至彼城已，其城所有乞人見者，皆呵責言：『汝從何來，而至於此？』
translation: When he arrived in that city, all the beggars there who saw him rebuked him, saying, 'Where did you come from to get here?'

source_sentence: 遂遮不聽遊行告乞。
translation: They then refused to listen to the procession's request.

source_sentence: 「爾時，彼人見有障礙，作是思惟：『我於彼輩，無有過失，何故障我而乞告也？』
translation: "Seeing an obstruction, that person then thinks, 'There's nothing wrong with me being among those people, so why is it that I'm asking for permission?'

source_sentence: 於時波羅[木*奈]城有一長者，遺失銅鉢，時彼長者求覓銅鉢，所在不獲，因求鉢故，至餘一村。
translation: It was then that an elder in Pola [munai] lost his copper bowl. That elder sought for a copper bowl, but didn't find one anywhere.

source_sentence: 時彼乞人，於糞聚中，得彼銅鉢，掛於杖頭，將來往入波羅[木*奈]城，從街至街，從巷至巷，從此交巷至彼交巷，從此隅角至彼隅角，口唱是言：『此之銅鉢，是誰之物？
translation: That beggar then, having found his copper bowl in the garbage, put it on the end of his staff, and went into the city of Pola [munai], going from street to street, from lane to lane, from this intersection to that intersection, and from this corner to that corner, saying this, 'Whose copper bowl is this?'

source_sentence: 識者收取。』
translation: Those who know it will receive it.'

source_sentence: 而彼遊歷處處東西，求覓其主了不能得。
translation: He traveled from place to place, looking for his master, but was unable to find him.

source_sentence: 既不得主，便即往至付梵德王。
translation: Not having found the owner, he then went to deliver it to King Brahmā.

source_sentence: 乃至長者後聞有人從彼糞中，得一銅鉢，掛於杖頭，將來入彼波羅[木*奈]城，從街至街，從巷至巷，而口唱言：『是誰銅鉢？』
translation: Eventually, the elder heard that someone had taken a copper bowl from that dung and hung it on the end of his staff, and then he went into that city of [Mokṣala] and went from street to street and from lane to lane, saying, 'Who is this copper bowl?'

source_sentence: 處處遊訪，不知主處，既不得主，便付梵德。
translation: He went from place to place, not knowing where his master was, but when he didn't hear from him, he turned to the Brahmā virtues.

source_sentence: 既聞是已，到梵德邊，到已白言：『大王！
translation: After hearing this, he went to the Bhadrapāla and when he arrived, he said, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 當知，前者乞人，所奉銅鉢，是我之物。』
translation: You should know that the copper bowl that the beggar before you offered was mine.'

source_sentence: 「時，梵德王遣使往喚彼之乞人，而語之言：『汝於前者，所送銅鉢，今此長者云是我許，其事如何？』
translation: "King Brahmā then sent an envoy to summon that beggar and told him, 'What happened to the copper bowl that you gave to him and that this elder now says is mine?'

source_sentence: 彼人即白梵德王言：『如是大王！
translation: That person then said to King Brahmā, 'Thus, great king!

source_sentence: 我本不知彼之銅鉢是誰之物？
translation: "I didn't know whose copper bowl he had.

source_sentence: 在糞聚中，我既得已，即掛杖頭，將來往入波羅[木*奈]城，東西訪問不知主處，以不得主，遂即將來奉與大王，任王所用。』
translation: Now that I've gotten it, I'll hang up my staff and go into the city of [Mokṣala] in the future. I don't know where my lord is when I go there or thereabouts, so I won't get to lord it.

source_sentence: 「爾時，梵德聞彼語已，心大歡喜，而告彼言：『仁者！
translation: "After hearing what they said, the Brahmā rejoiced greatly, and he told them, 'Sir!

source_sentence: 汝今欲於我邊乞何等願？
translation: What vow would you like to ask of me now?

source_sentence: 我當與汝。
translation: I will give it to you.

source_sentence: 而彼銅鉢，還其長者。』
translation: Then return that copper bowl to its elder.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，彼人白梵德王，作如是言：『大王！
translation: "At that point, that man said to King Brahmā, "Thus, Great King!

source_sentence: 今若必欲歡喜與我願者，願王於此波羅[木*奈]城，所有乞人，用我為王。』
translation: Now, if you must rejoice and give me your vow, may the king make me king over all the beggars in this city of [Pārāṇasī].'

source_sentence: 時梵德王，復告彼言：『今者何用與彼乞兒而為王也？
translation: King Brahmā then again addressed them, saying, 'Why would you make that beggar king?'

source_sentence: 但當更乞諸餘好願，或金或銀，或索國中最勝村落，用為封邑，我即與汝。』
translation: Perhaps you should ask for another good vow, whether it's for gold or silver, or for the finest village in the country to use as a feudal domain, and I will give it to you.'

source_sentence: 時彼乞人，復白王言：『王若歡喜，與我願者，我今止欲得前所願。』
translation: That beggar then again said to the king, 'If it pleases the king to grant me the vow, I'll stop now and wish for what I had before.'

source_sentence: 王遂報言：『任汝所樂，隨汝作耳。』
translation: The king then replied, 'Do as you like; do as you like.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，在彼波羅[木*奈]城，合有五百乞兒依住，彼乞願者，悉喚令集而告之言：『我今得與汝等為王，汝等必當聽我處分。』
translation: "At the time, there were five hundred beggars living in the city of Pola [munai], and they all summoned the beggar to gather and told him, 'Now, I've made you all king, and you must listen to my portion.'

source_sentence: 時諸乞人問彼王言：『汝今云何處分我等？
translation: The beggars then asked the king, 'How will you now dispose of us?'

source_sentence: 令作何事？』
translation: What is it that you are commanded to do?'

source_sentence: 時彼人言：『汝等相共，或有捉我置髆上者，或有取我而背負者，自餘皆悉為我左右，圍遶而行。』
translation: Those people then said, 'Some of you may have grabbed me and put me on a shoulder blade, or some of you may have picked me up and carried me on your backs, but the rest of you are all walking around me.'

source_sentence: 而彼五百諸乞兒輩，聞彼語已，即從處分，或有輿者，或背負者，處處遊行，所有飲食坐席之所，即往彼乞，乞已將向一處分張，而共食噉，如是方便多時活命。
translation: After hearing what they said, those five hundred beggars then took their places, either with a hand-carried man or a man carrying a load, and marched from place to place to find a place to eat or drink, so they went there to solicit some food and drink, then spread it out to one place after soliciting it, ate it together, and lived for a long time with this method.

source_sentence: 「時，有一人屏處獨食摩呼荼迦(隋言歡喜丸)，爾時，乞王從其人邊，奪取彼食摩呼荼迦，奪已將走。
translation: "At the time, a man was standing in a quiet place, eating a mahoutaka (Sui word for joy ball) by himself, when the king of beggars snatched the mahoutaka he was eating from his side and was about to leave after snatching it.

source_sentence: 其王徒眾五百乞兒，逐彼王走至於遠處，皆悉疲乏，既疲乏已，悉各迴還。
translation: The king's retinue of 500 beggars chased him far away, all of them weary, and when they were tired, they each returned.

source_sentence: 其彼乞王，身力壯健，走而不乏，更至遠已，迴頭望看，五百乞兒，悉皆不見。
translation: That beggar king, who was strong and sturdy and had walked without getting tired, turned around when he got farther away and looked, and all five hundred beggars had disappeared.

source_sentence: 既不見已，入一園內，取水洗手，坐於一邊，欲食彼食。
translation: When he hadn't seen them, he went into a garden, got some water, washed his hands, sat down on one side, and wanted to eat their food.

source_sentence: 未食之間，便生悔心：『我今不善。
translation: Before he could eat, he became remorseful and said, 'Now, I've been unkind.

source_sentence: 我今何故，於彼人邊，奪取其食？
translation: Why did I snatch that person's food from their side?'

source_sentence: 更復誑我隨從人輩？
translation: How could you deceive me into following the steps of others?

source_sentence: 此食既多，我食不盡。
translation: This food is so abundant that I won't be able to eat it all.

source_sentence: 若世間內有諸聖人，願知我意而來此者，我即分與。』
translation: If there are sages in the world who wish to know my intention and come here, I'll share it with them.'

source_sentence: 發是心已，有辟支佛，名曰善賢，從虛空裏飛騰而來，在彼人前，從空直下，去其不遠。
translation: After he gave rise to this thought, a pratyekabuddha named Shanxi came soaring up out of the sky in front of that person, descended straight down from the sky, and wasn't far away.

source_sentence: 其人遙見彼辟支佛，威儀庠序，行步齊停，舉動得所，不緩不急，見如是已，於彼辟支，心得淨信。
translation: That person sees that pratyekabuddha from a distance, his manner is peaceful, his steps are aligned, he moves appropriately, and he's not slow or hasty.

source_sentence: 得淨心已，作如是念：『由我往昔所受貧賤，及以現在，皆悉不值如是福田，於如是人，不行布施恭敬供養；我昔若值如是福田，今日應不遭斯困頓，亦應不被他人逼切而得活命。
translation: After attaining a pure mind, he thinks, 'Because I was poor and disadvantaged in the past and am now, I didn't deserve such a field of merit, and I didn't make alms and respectful offerings to such a person; if I'd received such a field of merit in the past, I wouldn't be in such distress today, and I wouldn't have been forced by others to live.

source_sentence: 我今將此摩呼荼食，奉上仙人，未審此仙受納已不？
translation: Now, I'm going to offer this meal of mahôdra to an immortal.

source_sentence: 若蒙受者，願我將來免此貧賤困厄之身。』
translation: If I were to accept this, may I be spared this poor, disadvantaged, and troubled body in the future.'

source_sentence: 作是念已，即將此食摩呼荼迦，奉此仙人。
translation: After he had this thought, he then gave this food, the mahôtaka, to this sage.

source_sentence: 然辟支佛，有如是法，唯現神通，教化眾生，更無別法。
translation: Still, this is the kind of thing that a pratyekabuddha does, except for manifesting supernormal powers and teaching sentient beings; there's no other way.

source_sentence: 時辟支佛，受取彼食摩呼荼迦，愍斯人故，從彼地方，騰空而去。
translation: Then, having accepted that food and taken it to Mahāutaka, Pārśva took pity on that person and left that place, so he rose into the air and departed.

source_sentence: 其人見彼辟支世尊騰空去已，歡喜踊躍，遍滿其體，不能自勝，以歡喜心，頂戴指掌，遙禮彼尊辟支佛足，作是禮已，心發是願：『願我此身，於未來世，恒常值遇如是世尊，或勝此者，而彼世尊所說之法，願我一聞速得證解。
translation: When that person saw that Bhagavān ascending into the sky and departing, he was overcome with joy and exultation that filled his body, and he couldn't contain himself.

source_sentence: 又願我於未來世中，在大威德豪族姓家，為王治化，更莫在彼貧兒之內。』
translation: May I also spend the next few lifetimes in a house of a powerful clan, ruling and teaching for the king, and may I not be among those poor children.'

source_sentence: 復作是願：『生生世世，不墮惡道。』」
translation: Again, he made this vow: 'From birth to life, I won't fall into a bad path.'"

source_sentence: 佛告諸比丘作如是言：「汝諸比丘！
translation: The Buddha addressed the monks and said, "You monks!

source_sentence: 若有心疑，於彼之時，波羅[木*奈]城，乞兒之王，施辟支佛摩呼荼迦，此是誰者？
translation: If there's any doubt in your mind, who was it that, at the time, was the king of the beggars in the city of Pola [munai] who gave Mahākūṭaka, the pratyekabuddha?

source_sentence: 莫作異見，婆提唎迦比丘是也。
translation: "Don't take it differently, Bhadrika the monk.

source_sentence: 時乞兒王施辟支佛摩呼荼食，因彼業果，今生釋種，大豪貴族，乃至資財，無所乏少。
translation: At the time, King Beggar gave food to Pṛthivī Mahākauṣṭhila, and as a result of his actions, he was born into the Śākyamuni lineage, a great and noble family, and his possessions were not lacking.

source_sentence: 復於彼時，作如是願：『願我來世，於大威德豪族種姓，為王教化。』
translation: Again, he made this vow: 'May I be born in a future life among a great, powerful, and noble family, and may I be a teacher to the king.'

source_sentence: 因彼業報，今於釋種，得受王位。
translation: As a result of that karmic retribution, now I've been granted the position of king among the Śākya clan.

source_sentence: 又時乞願：『願我當來，生生世世，不墮惡道。』
translation: He then begged, 'May I be born in the future and not fall into a bad path.'

source_sentence: 因彼業報，不曾生墮惡道之中，恒生人天，流轉往反，多受快樂。
translation: As a result of that karmic retribution, I won't be born in a bad destiny, but will always be born among humans and gods, and I'll go back and forth in transit and enjoy many pleasures.

source_sentence: 又時復乞如是願言：『願我來世，恒值如是辟支世尊，或勝此者，彼之世尊所說經法，願我聞已，速知速解。』
translation: Again, he begged and vowed, 'May I always meet such a world-honored one as Pratibhāna, or may he be better than this one, and may I hear the teachings of that world-honored one and quickly know and understand them.'

source_sentence: 因彼業報，今值於我，而得出家，受具足戒，得羅漢果。
translation: Because of the results of their actions, now, thanks to me, they've left home, received the full set of precepts, and attained the fruit of the arhat.

source_sentence: 我又授記：『於我聲聞弟子之中，豪姓出家最第一者，婆提唎迦比丘是也。』
translation: I also gave him this prediction: 'Among my śrāvaka disciples, the most distinguished one who left home because of his noble family was the monk Bhadrika.'

source_sentence: 「汝諸比丘！
translation: "You monks!

source_sentence: 婆提唎迦昔造如是善根因緣，以造如是善根因故，今生豪姓釋種之家，大富大貴，乃至資財無所乏少。
translation: "In the past, Bhadrika created such causes and conditions of good roots, and as a result of creating such causes of good roots, she was born into a noble family of the Śākyas, which became very wealthy and prosperous, so much so that her possessions were not lacking.

source_sentence: 於釋種中，得紹王位，捨其王位，而得出家，受具足戒得羅漢果，故我授記，於我聲聞弟子之中，豪姓出家，婆提唎迦比丘第一。」
translation: Among the Śākyamuni lineage, he attained the rank of king, left his position as king, left home, received the full set of precepts, and attained the fruit of the arhat; therefore, I have granted a prediction that among my śrāvaka disciples, the Bhadrika monk is the first among the noble renunciant families."

source_sentence: 其彼長老婆提唎迦，乃至已得阿羅漢果，恒住蘭若，乞食活命，著糞掃衣，常坐不臥，隨宜鋪設，唯持三衣，更無畜積。
translation: That elder monk, Wadrika, even after he attains the fruit of the arhat, lives in a forest, begs for food, wears robes made of rags, always sits and doesn't lie down, spreads out as appropriate, and carries only three garments, leaving nothing to store.

source_sentence: 至於一時，依住在彼舍婆提城，於阿蘭若樹林之內。
translation: One time, he was staying in that city of Śrāvastī in the forest of the forest of araṇya.

source_sentence: 時彼長老求覓諸草及以樹葉，了不能得，即時求覓乾白象糞，聚以為鋪，上鋪坐具，結加趺坐，端身正直，即得正念。
translation: That elder then sought grass and leaves, but was unable to find them. He then sought dried white elephant dung, gathered it together to make a bunk, spread out sitting cloth on top, sat cross-legged, straightened his body, and attained right mindfulness.

source_sentence: 過於一夜。
translation: He spent the rest of the night there.

source_sentence: 爾時，長老婆提唎迦，於晨朝時，著衣持鉢，欲往入彼舍婆提城，往來乞食。
translation: At the time, Dīrikā, the elder wife, gathered his robe and bowl in the morning as he was about to enter that city of Śrāvastī and go begging for food.

source_sentence: 於彼之時，城內多有乞食諸人，乞得食已，從其城出，去城不遠，各各別欲食所得食。
translation: At the time, there were many people in the city who were begging for food, and after they had obtained it, they left the city and went not far from it, each wanting to eat the food they had obtained.

source_sentence: 爾時，長老婆提唎迦，遙見如是諸乞食人從城乞食，既得彼食，去城不遠，別坐欲食，遂往彼邊，默然而住。
translation: At the time, Dīrikā, the elder wife, saw these beggars come from the city to solicit food, and after they had obtained food, they went far from the city, sat down separately, and wanted to eat, so they went to the other side and stayed there in silence.

source_sentence: 爾時，一切諸乞人等，作如是念：「此之比丘，必於我等，欲有憐愍，故來乞食。」
translation: At the time, all of those beggars thought, "Surely this monk wants to have compassion on us, so he came to solicit food."

source_sentence: 作是念已，各各自於所食之內，減取少分，與彼長老婆提唎迦。
translation: After they thought this, each of them took a small portion of what they had eaten and gave it to that elder monk Tilākā.

source_sentence: 爾時，波斯那憍薩羅國其王，乘騎一大白象，其象名曰一分陀利，從其彼城舍婆提出，共一大臣，其臣名曰尸利跋陀(隋言德賢)。
translation: It was then that the king of that country Prasenajit, riding on a large white elephant named Pindari, came from that city of Śrāvastī with a minister named Sirīputra (Sui word for virtuous man).

source_sentence: 時，波斯那憍薩羅國其王，遙見婆提唎迦從彼乞兒乞食而食，即告大臣尸利跋陀作如是言：「尸利跋陀！
translation: When the king of that country, Prasenajit, saw Bhadrika from a distance begging for food from that beggar, he told his minister Śiribhadra, "Śiribhadra!

source_sentence: 此何比丘？
translation: What kind of monk is this?

source_sentence: 乃從乞兒，乞食而喫。」
translation: He then begged a beggar for food and a meal."

source_sentence: 爾時，大臣審更熟看婆提唎迦，知是不虛，而白王言：「大王！
translation: The minister then looked more closely at Bhadrika, knew it wasn't false, and said to the king, "Great king!

source_sentence: 當知，此是釋王婆提唎迦。」
translation: You should know that this is the Śākyamuni king Bhadrika."

source_sentence: 其王即告彼大臣言：「若如此者，汝驅白象，向彼婆提唎迦之邊。」
translation: The king then told his minister, "If that's the case, drive the white elephant to the side of that Bhadrika."

source_sentence: 尸利跋陀聞王勅已，而白王言：「如王教勅，不敢違也。」
translation: After hearing the king's order, Siribhadra said to the king, "As the king has commanded, I dare not disobey."

source_sentence: 受王勅已，將此白象，王乘其上，詣向長老婆提迦邊。
translation: After he received the king's order, he put this white elephant on his back and rode it to the edge of Jātrikā.

source_sentence: 時，波斯那憍薩羅國其王，去彼婆提唎迦住處不遠，從其象上下，禮長老婆提唎迦，禮彼足已，却住一面。
translation: Not far from where he was staying, the king of that country Prasenajitika went down from his elephant, paid homage to Jātaka Jātaka, saluted his feet, and withdrew to one side.

source_sentence: 時，波斯那憍薩羅國王，啟白長老婆提唎迦，作如是言：「阿梨耶！
translation: The king of that country, Pūrṇa Kauṇḍala, then revealed to Jātaka Bodhirīka and said, "Ariṣṭa!

source_sentence: 今者何故乃發如是貧賤之意，乃於如此貧人等邊，乞食而食？」
translation: Why did he have such a poor mind and go begging for food from such a poor person?"

source_sentence: 爾時，長老婆提唎迦，告波斯那憍薩羅王，作如是言：「大王！
translation: It was then that the eldest wife, Dīrikā, addressed King Prasenajit, saying thus, "Great king!

source_sentence: 我今不以貧故而從彼乞，我今自有七種寶財，但我意樂從於貧人而乞食耳，又欲令彼諸貧兒輩斷貧窮故，而從乞也。
translation: Now, I don't beg from them because I'm poor; I have seven kinds of treasures at my disposal, but I'm happy to beg food from a poor person, and I beg because I want to end poverty for that poor group of children.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 當知，我已有眼，但欲為彼無明眾生開眼目故，而來從乞。
translation: You should know that I already have eyes, but I came here to ask for them because I wanted to open their eyes for those ignorant sentient beings.

source_sentence: 「復次，大王！
translation: "Furthermore, Great King!

source_sentence: 我今已脫一切繫縛，但以為彼貪欲瞋恚所縛眾生得解脫故，而從乞食。
translation: Now, I've been freed from all fetters, but I'm begging for food because I want to free sentient beings bound by desire and anger.

source_sentence: 「大王！
translation: "Great king!

source_sentence: 我今已度彼岸，但為拔脫煩惱淤泥所溺眾生，故從彼乞。
translation: Now, I've crossed to the other shore, but I begged from there to get rid of the sentient beings sunken in the muck of affliction.

source_sentence: 「復次，大王！
translation: "Furthermore, Great King!

source_sentence: 我已獲得無病之處，但欲治彼煩惱所病諸眾生故，而從彼乞。」
translation: I've gained a place where I'm not sick, but I beg from them because I want to treat the beings who are sick from their afflictions."

source_sentence: 時波斯那憍薩羅國其王，復白婆提唎迦作如是言：「阿梨耶！
translation: The king of that country, Pūrṇa Kauṣṭhila, then said to Bhadrika, "Ārya!

source_sentence: 我亦貧無七種財寶，我亦幽冥住於黑闇，我亦被於煩惱淤泥之所沈溺，我今亦有貪欲之病，願阿梨耶！
translation: I am also poor and lacking in the seven treasures, I am dark and dwelling in darkness, I am sunken in the muck of affliction, and I am sick with desire, may Ārya!

source_sentence: 憐愍我故，唯悕數數來至我家。」
translation: Because of your kindness to me, you only want to come to my house repeatedly."

source_sentence: 爾時，長老婆提唎迦，告波斯那憍薩羅王，作如是言：「大德大王！
translation: It was then that the eldest wife, Dīrikā, addressed King Pūrṇa Kauśālā and said, "Great king!

source_sentence: 不須如此。」
translation: It doesn't have to be like this."

source_sentence: 作是語已，捨王而去。
translation: After saying this, he abandoned the king and departed.

source_sentence: 佛本行集經摩尼婁陀品第五十九上
translation: Sutra of the Collection of the Past Activities of the Buddha, Chapter 59 on Maṇiluṣṭha

source_sentence: 又時，世尊為諸比丘演說諸法，於時長老摩尼婁陀睡眠不覺。
translation: It was also while the Bhagavān was teaching the Dharma to the monks that the elder Mānilūta fell asleep and didn't realize it.

source_sentence: 爾時，佛告摩尼婁陀，作如是言：「摩尼婁陀！
translation: The Buddha then addressed Māṇiruddha and said, "Māṇiruddha!

source_sentence: 汝何於此法義之內，如是睡眠，汝於此事，深為不善。
translation: Why do you thus sleep within the meaning of this teaching? This is deeply unwholesome for you.

source_sentence: 汝起莫睡！」
translation: Get up and don't sleep!"

source_sentence: 從此已後，摩尼婁陀更不睡臥，正以多時，不得睡故，壞其肉眼，唯以天眼，觀世間色。
translation: After that, Māṇiruddha stopped sleeping and lay down, and it was because he hadn't been able to sleep for so many hours that he destroyed his physical eyes and looked at worldly forms with only his divine eyes.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告比丘言：「汝諸比丘！
translation: At that point, the Bhagavān addressed the monks, "You monks!

source_sentence: 於我聲聞諸弟子中，清淨梵行，最第一者，所謂摩尼婁陀是也。」
translation: Among my śrāvaka disciples, the one who performs the purest religious practice and is the most eminent is called Māṇiluṣṭha."

source_sentence: 又於一時，摩尼婁陀數數縫綻諸衣裳等，又時五指總持五針。
translation: At one point, Mānilūta was sewing and blistering his robes and so forth several times, and he was holding five needles in his five fingers.

source_sentence: 爾時，長老大目揵連詣向其所，而語之言：「摩尼婁陀！
translation: At the time, the eldest monk, Maudgalyāyana, went to him and said, "Mānilūta!

source_sentence: 汝今共我遊行去來。」
translation: Now, you and I will march off and come together."

source_sentence: 爾時，長老摩尼婁陀報目連言：「長老目連！
translation: It was then that the elder Maṇiluṣṭha reported to Maudgalyāyana, "Elder Maudgalyāyana!

source_sentence: 且住且住！
translation: Stay, stay, stay!

source_sentence: 待我衣成。」
translation: Wait for my robe to be completed."

source_sentence: 爾時，目連復語長老摩尼婁陀：「汝今若以神通縫者，願速成就，若以今意所欲成者，亦願早成。」
translation: It was then that Maudgalyāyana again said to the elder Māṇiruddha, "Now, if you sew it with your supernormal powers, may it be done quickly, and if you wish to do it with your present intention, may it also be done sooner."

source_sentence: 摩尼婁陀縫此衣時，其針綖脫，爾時長老摩尼婁陀，獨自唱言：「世間誰樂欲作功德？
translation: When Māṇiruddha was sewing this garment, his needle came free, and the elder Māṇiruddha alone called out, "Who in the world would like to work for merit?

source_sentence: 與我穿針。」
translation: Thread the needle with me."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊獨在房內，攝心坐禪，乃以清淨天耳，聞此摩尼婁陀作如是語。
translation: The Bhagavān was sitting alone in his room, collected in his mind and sitting in meditation, when he heard this maniruddha speak in this way with the pure divine ear.

source_sentence: 聞是語已，譬如壯士屈申臂頃，即於本處，不現其身，往至長老摩尼婁陀，住於前已，取針而貫。
translation: After hearing that, he was like a strong man who flexes his arm and goes to the elder Māṇiruddha without showing himself at his original location, and after staying there, he takes a needle and threads it.

source_sentence: 爾時，長老摩尼婁陀問言：「是誰為我穿針？」
translation: At that point, the elder Māṇiruddha asked, "Who will thread the needle for me?"

source_sentence: 佛告之言：「摩尼婁陀！
translation: The Buddha told them, "Māṇiruddha!

source_sentence: 是我為汝貫穿針耳。」
translation: I've pierced the needle for you."

source_sentence: 爾時，一切諸比丘等，傳聞此語云道：「世尊為彼長老摩尼婁陀，以綖穿針。」
translation: At the time, all the monks and others heard this statement, saying, "The Bhagavān threaded a needle through a thread of thread for that elder Maṇiluṣṭha."

source_sentence: 既聞此語，各各思惟：「世尊猶尚為彼清淨梵行之人，佐助不辦，況復我等，何故默然不相助也？」
translation: When they heard that, they each thought, "The Bhagavān still doesn't assist that person of pure religious practice, so why wouldn't we be silent and not assist him?"

source_sentence: 因爾已後，諸比丘僧，有所作者，各各相助。
translation: After that, the monks and nuns each had a task to perform, and each helped the other.

source_sentence: 時，諸比丘以此因緣，往詣佛所白言：「世尊！
translation: It was for this reason that the monks went to the Buddha and said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 其彼長老摩尼婁陀，往於昔日種何善業？
translation: "What good deeds did that elder Maṇiluṣṭha plant in the past?

source_sentence: 今得出家，受具足戒，得羅漢果。
translation: Now, he has left home, received the full set of precepts, and attained the fruit of the arhat.

source_sentence: 世尊復記言：『諸比丘！
translation: The Bhagavān then recorded this, saying, 'Monks!

source_sentence: 於我聲聞弟子之中，得淨天眼，最第一者，所謂長老摩尼婁陀比丘是也。』」
translation: Among my śrāvaka disciples, the one who has attained the pure divine eye and is the foremost is the elder Moniruddha monk.'"

source_sentence: 作是語已，佛告一切諸比丘言：「汝諸比丘！
translation: After he said this, the Buddha addressed the monks, saying, "You monks!

source_sentence: 我念往昔，過去久遠，超於無量阿僧祇劫，有佛出世，名曰然燈如來、應供、正遍知、明行足、善逝、世間解、無上士、調御丈夫、天人師、佛、世尊。
translation: I think back in the distant past, long ago and beyond an incalculably long eon, there was a Buddha who appeared in the world and was called Randana Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, Perfectly Omniscient, Perfectly Virtuous, Well Gone, Understander of the World, Unsurpassed Person, Tamer of Beings, Teacher of Gods and People, Buddha, and World Honored One.

source_sentence: 彼佛世尊，為諸比丘，說法之時，種種讚歎天眼之事。
translation: When the Bhagavān taught those monks, he praised the divine eye in various ways.

source_sentence: 「爾時，有一居士之子，名曰大財，來集彼會，坐於眾內，聽說其法。
translation: "At the time, a householder's son named Dazai gathered at that meeting, sat down inside the congregation, and listened to the teaching.

source_sentence: 彼居士子，既聽法已，作是思惟：『我今雖復不諮父母捨家出家，我今但可為未來世得天眼故，造諸善根。』
translation: After listening to the teaching, that householder's son thought, 'Now, even though I won't consult my parents about leaving home or leaving home, I can only create good roots for the sake of attaining the divine eye in the future.'

source_sentence: 作是念已，備辦脂油，得其百斗，於然燈佛無上正真等正覺所，然燈供養，心起是願：『願我來世，值如是佛，彼佛說法，速得證解，於彼世尊聲聞弟子所有天眼，願我第一。』
translation: After he had this thought, he prepared a hundred doses of fat and oil, placed it in the Randana Buddha's unsurpassed, true, and perfectly enlightened abode, made offerings with a lamp, and made this vow: 'May I meet such a Buddha in a future life, speedily realize the understanding of his teachings, and may I be the first among the śrāvaka disciples of that world-honored one to possess the divine eye.'

source_sentence: 又發是願：『生生世世，不墮惡道。』
translation: And he also gave rise to this vow: 'From birth to life, I won't fall into bad states.'

source_sentence: 爾時，然燈如來、應供、正遍知、明行足、善逝、世間解、無上士、調御丈夫、天人師、佛、世尊，告彼居士子大財言：『於未來世有佛，名曰釋迦牟尼多他伽多、阿羅訶、三藐三佛陀，十號具足，於彼世尊聲聞弟子，得天眼者，汝當第一。』」
translation: At that point, the Randana Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, Perfectly Omniscient, Perfect in Knowledge and Conduct, Well Gone, Understander of the World, Unsurpassed Person, Trainer, Teacher of Gods and People, Buddha, and Bhagavān addressed that householder son, Dazai, saying, 'In a future life there will be a Buddha named Śākyamuni, Tathāgata, Arhat, Samantabhadra, and fully equipped with the ten epithets; among the śrāvaka disciples of that world-honored one who has attained the divine eye, you will be the first.'"

source_sentence: 爾時，佛告諸比丘言：「汝等比丘！
translation: At that point, the Buddha addressed the monks, saying, "You monks!

source_sentence: 或有心疑，彼時然燈佛邊，大富居士子大財者？
translation: Are there people who doubt in their minds that at that time there was a wealthy householder by the side of Randana Buddha who had great wealth?

source_sentence: 此即摩尼婁陀是也。」
translation: This is Māṇiluṣṭha."

source_sentence: 爾時，佛復告諸比丘作如是言：「我念往昔，久遠之時，有一賊人，於闇夜中，行在小徑，欲為竊盜，至於半路，其鞋綱斷。
translation: It was then that the Buddha again addressed the monks, saying, "I think back in the distant past, there was a thief who traveled down a path in the dark of night, intending to steal, and he got halfway there and cut off his sandals.

source_sentence: 「爾時，彼處有一辟支佛舍利塔，於其塔所，時有一人，然燈求福供養承事，而彼燈油，將欲盡滅。
translation: "At the time, there was a pratyekabuddha's relics stūpa there, and at the stūpa there was a man who turned on a lamp, sought to make offerings for the good of the monastery, and was about to extinguish the lamp's oil.

source_sentence: 其賊至彼，見燈欲盡，為欲續彼斷鞋綱故，遂益其脂，又以箭鏃，挑出燈炷。
translation: When the thief arrived, he saw that the lamp was about to run out and, wanting to renew the thread of his broken shoes, he added fat to it and picked out the wick with an arrow.

source_sentence: 爾時，彼燈還得明熾。
translation: At that point, the lamp was still burning brightly.

source_sentence: 「爾時，彼賊見燈明已，去邊不遠，續彼鞋綱。
translation: "Seeing the lamp light up, the thief went out to the other side and renewed the manacles of his shoes.

source_sentence: 因彼明故，得見彼塔。
translation: Because of that light, he was able to see that stūpa.

source_sentence: 見彼塔已，遂得心淨，得心淨已，發如是願：『此塔是誰？
translation: After seeing that stūpa, he then attained mental purity, and after attaining mental purity, he made this vow: 'Who is this stūpa?'

source_sentence: 願我來世，當值此塔本體世尊，或勝此者，若彼世尊所說之法，願我聞已，速得知解，於彼世尊所有聲聞弟子之中，得天眼者，最為第一。
translation: May I meet the Bhagavān who is the original body of this stūpa in a future life, or may I surpass him, and may I quickly learn and understand the teaching that he teaches, so that among all the śrāvaka disciples of that Bhagavān, the one who attains the divine eye will be the best.

source_sentence: 又願當來，生生世世，不墮惡道。』」
translation: May I also hope that in the future, I'll be born for generations and won't fall into a bad path.'"

source_sentence: 佛本行集經卷第五十九
translation: Sutra of the Collection of the Past Activities of the Buddha, Volume 59
